result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl E Thornton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl E Thornton

defendant.name: Thornton, Carl E

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Carl E Thornton in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Carl E Thornton.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard, ready to proceed with the plea and sentencing. Atty Key requests the Domestic abuse enhancer stricken. DA confirms. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with defendant. 
Defendant plead guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 

State is heard on sentence. Recommends a $200.00 fine plus costs. 
Atty Key is heard on sentence. 

Court orders a a $200.00 fine plus costs. Totaling $705.00. $150.00 bond will be applied. Total 555.00. 60DTP.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

1:36 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Carl E Thornton appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Carl E Thornton.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard on status.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant comments.

Bond remains as set previously,
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court finds probable cause.  

No monetary modifications to bond. 
New bond to be signed for new condition.  New condition is def is to have No contact with JCA.
